awd_titl_txt: Planning: Academic Center of Excellence in STEM (ACES) through the Arts
awd_abstract_narration:
The Historically Black Colleges and Universities - Undergraduate Program (HBCU-UP) provides support to strengthen STEM undergraduate education and research at HBCUs. Using the Fine and Performing Arts as vehicles for teaching STEM provides opportunities to engage a broader audience of undergraduate students. Florida Memorial University seeks to innovate curriculum design and institutional change to increase recruitment and retention of HBCU students in STEM fields. As a step towards the advancement of integrated Arts and STEM instruction, this planning project brings together a collaborative interdepartmental team to execute a set of activities to establish the foundation for full development of a Center for STEM Academic Excellence through the Arts. The project aims to assemble a team to unlock effective pathways for a seamless and cohesive institutional paradigm shift in teaching STEM through the Arts. This planning project aligns with the goals of the HBCU-UP program in building opportunities to increase the number of HBCU undergraduate students in STEM fields.

This project aims to co-design a plan to identify the most appropriate Arts and STEM courses for integration and co-teaching, explore co-teaching models that pair Arts and STEM faculty for teaching traditional STEM courses with modified pedagogy, identify designs for teaching concepts of algebra, calculus, and chemistry in non-math/non-chemistry courses, and plan curriculum based on gamification principles that heighten student engagement. Student feedback will be incorporated in the plan through formal assessments. The project is consistent with the institution’s unified immersive experiential learning plan for increasing the number of prepared, competitive, and employment-ready graduates who enter the workforce as scientists, technologists, engineers, and mathematicians or pursue STEM graduate education and research careers. The institution aims to use the lessons learned from the planning activities to develop an implementation proposal submission.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

por.por_cntn:
The FMU STEM Center for Academic Excellence through the Arts project was initiated with the primary goal of breaking down the traditional boundaries and silos that have historically compartmentalized STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) education within the School of Arts and Sciences at our institution. The separation of STEM disciplines from the arts has hindered interdisciplinary collaboration and innovation in education, prompting the need for this transformative endeavor.

Center's Mission:

The mission of the FMU STEM Center for Academic Excellence through the Arts is to revolutionize STEM education through the following objectives:

  1. Demystifying STEM: The Center harnesses the power of music and art as transformative tools to make STEM education more accessible, engaging, and comprehensible to a wider range of students.

  2. Fostering Interdisciplinary Collaboration: By breaking down barriers between STEM and the arts, the Center promotes collaboration among faculty members from diverse backgrounds, creating a more inclusive and innovative educational environment.

  3. Promoting Faculty Awareness: An essential aspect of the Center's mission is to raise awareness among faculty members within the School of Arts and Sciences about their significant contributions to the overall success of STEM education.

Objectives and Expected Outcomes:

a. Curriculum Development: The Center will develop and refine arts-integrated STEM curricula, incorporating music and art into STEM courses to enhance understanding and engagement.

b. Faculty Development: Faculty members will receive training and resources to effectively integrate arts elements into their STEM instruction, fostering creativity and interdisciplinary thinking.

c. Student Engagement: The Center aims to increase student engagement and retention in STEM disciplines by making learning more enjoyable and meaningful.

d. Interdisciplinary Research: Encouraging faculty members to collaborate on research projects that explore the intersections between STEM and the arts, leading to innovative discoveries and solutions.

Future Impact:

The establishment of the FMU STEM Center for Academic Excellence through the Arts has the potential to transform not only STEM education but also the broader educational landscape. It seeks to create a culture of inclusivity, collaboration, and creativity, fostering a more holistic approach to learning and problem-solving that extends beyond the boundaries of traditional academic disciplines.

As this initiative progresses, it is expected to contribute to a more vibrant, interdisciplinary educational environment, preparing students with the skills and mindset necessary for success in an increasingly complex and interconnected world. Moreover, it aims to inspire other educational institutions to explore similar innovative approaches to STEM education, further advancing the integration of the arts into STEM disciplines nationwide. This project outcome report marks a significant milestone in our journey toward achieving these objectives.
